Print examples of chapter 12 of 'R for Dummies'.

Source: R/chapters-auto.R
ch12.Rd

To print a listing of all examples of a chapter, use ch12(). To run all the examples of ch12(), use example(ch12).

ch12()

Examples

# Chapter 12
# Getting Data into and out of R

# NOTE : Most of the code depends on actions, directories
# and the presence of files. Code that isn't runnable is
# commented out.

# Getting Data into R

elements <- data.frame()

# Working with Files and Folders

## Understanding the working directory
getwd()
#> [1] "C:/Users/apdev/Documents/github/dummies/rfordummies/docs/reference"

# setwd("F:/git/roxygen2")
# getwd()
# setwd("F:\git\stringr")
# getwd()

file.path("f:", "git", "surveyor")
#> [1] "f:/git/surveyor"

# setwd(file.path("F:", "git", "roxygen2"))
# getwd()

file.path("F:", "git", "roxygen2", "roxygen2", "README.md" )
#> [1] "F:/git/roxygen2/roxygen2/README.md"

## Manipulating files

# list.files(file.path("F:", "git", "roxygen2"))
my.file <- tempfile()
my.file
#> [1] "C:\\Users\\apdev\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpMxflnb\\file4aa4650646d7"
write.csv(iris, file=my.file)
list.files(tempdir())
#> [1] "downlit"          "file4aa4650646d7" "file4aa4eab64c9" 

file.iris <- read.csv(my.file)

file.remove(my.file)
#> [1] TRUE
list.files(tempdir())
#> [1] "downlit"         "file4aa4eab64c9"
